lines.text: Yeah!
[after shooting King Arthur's sword in half]

Alright you Primitive Screwheads, listen up! You see this? This... is my BOOMSTICK! The twelve-gauge double-barreled Remington. S-Mart's top of the line. You can find this in the sporting goods department. That's right, this sweet baby was made in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Retails for about a hundred and nine, ninety five. It's got a walnut stock, cobalt blue steel, and a hair trigger. That's right. Shop smart. Shop S-Mart. You got that?
[last lines]

[voiceover]
Sure, I could have stayed in the past. I could have even been king. But in my own way, I *am* king.
[Ash grabs girl close]
Hail to the king, baby.
[Ash kisses the girl]
Good. Bad. I'm the guy with the gun.
[Upon getting the powered glove in place of his right hand]
Groovy.
[In a passionate moment of romance]
Gimme some sugar, baby.
You Sir, are not one of my vassals... who are you?
Who wants to know?
I am Henry the Red. Duke of Shale, Lord of the Northlands and leader of its peoples.
Jack and shit... and Jack left town.
Klaatu Barada N... Necktie... Neckturn... Nickel... It's an "N" word, it's definitely an "N" word! Klaatu... Barada... N...
[coughs]

[pause]
Okay then... that's it!
Klaatu Barada Nikto.
Well, repeat them.
Klaatu Barada Nikto.
Again.
I got it, I got it! I know your damn words, alright?

[to the Witch]
Yo, she-bitch! Let's go!
I'll swallow your soul!
Come get some.
Lady, I'm afraid I'm gonna have to ask you to leave the store.
Who the hell are you?
Name's Ash.
[cocks rifle]
Housewares.
You found me beautiful once...
Honey, you got reeeal ugly!
Hail to the king, baby.
Are all men from the future loud-mouthed braggarts?
Nope. Just me baby... Just me.
[from Director's Cut]
What are you? Are you me?
Whad are do? Are do be? HAHAHAHAHAH! You sound like a jerk!
Why ya doin' this, huh?
Oh, you wanna know? 'Cause the answer's easy! I'm BAD Ash... and you're GOOD Ash! You're a goody little two-shoes! Little goody two-shoes! Little goody two-shoes!
[begins to sucker-punch Ash]
Goody little TWO-SHOES! Goody little TWO-SHOES! HEHEHEHEHE!
[honk honk honk]
GOODY LITTLE TWO-SHOES! GOODY LITTLE...
[cocks shotgun and points it under Evil Ash's nose]
[nods head and shoots him]
Good. Bad. I'm the guy with the gun.
I may be bad... but I feel gooood.
But what of all those sweet words you spoke in private?
Oh that's just what we call pillow talk, baby, that's all.
Maybe. Just maybe my boys can protect the book. Yeah, and maybe I'm a Chinese jet pilot.
[after Ash chops up Evil Ash with a chainsaw and throws him into a hole]
You'll never retrieve the Necronomicon! You'll die before ya get it!
Hey! What's that you got on your face?
Huh?
[Ash throws dirt on Evil Ash's face]
See how that works?

[as a soldier blocks his way, he pushes him aside]
Get the fuck out of my face!
When you removed the book from the cradle, did you speak the words?
Yeah, basically.
Did you speak the exact words?
Look, maybe I didn't say every single little tiny syllable, no. But basically I said them, yeah.
It's a trick. Get an axe.
[Sheila wants to apologize to Ash]
First you wanna kill me, now you wanna kiss me. Blow.
Don't touch that please, your primitive intellect wouldn't understand alloys and compositions and things with... molecular structures.
Alright. Who wants some?
[first lines]
[opening monologue]
My name is Ash and I am a slave. Close as I can figure, the year is thirteen hundred A.D and I'm being dragged to my death. It wasn't always like this, I had a real life, once. A job.

[now Ash is in a flashback]
Umm... Hardware aisle twelve, shop smart, shop S-Mart!

Necronomiconexmortis. The Book of the Dead. Bound in human flesh and inked in blood, this ancient Samarian text contained bizarre burial rights, funeral incantations, and demon resurrection passages, it was never meant for the world of the living. The book awoke something dark in the woods, something evil.
[something crashes through the window of the cabin and Linda screams]
It took Linda. Then it came after me, it got into my hand and it went bad, so I lopped it off at the wrist.
[Ash is seen cutting off his hand]
But that didn't stop it, it came back big time.

[Ash gets pulled into the vortex holding onto the doorway]
For God's sake how do you stop it?
[Ash falls into the vortex and the opening credits start]
[when Sheila walks into the blacksmith's shop to talk to Ash]
What? Were you raised in a barn? Shut the door! Probably was raised in a barn, along with the other primitives.
I got a bone to pick with you.
You're pissing me off, you ugly son of a bitch!
Now whoa whoa whoa right there spinach chin!

[trying to kill a small Ash that has jumped into his mouth and into his stomach, he gets a kettle of boiling water]
Okay, little fella, here's a little
[shouts]
hot chocolate for ya! Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

[after been converted by the deadites, she pulls back her veil revealing a rather pasty looking complexion]
I may be bad, but I feel... good.
[as undead Ash stands triumphant on catapult]
Buckle up Bonehead. 'Cause you're goin' for a ride!
How will we stop an army of the dead at our castle walls? How will you fight that? With more words? Most of our people have already fled. We are but sixty men.
[as an evil Ash begins growing out of his shoulder]
Oh, dear God, it's growing bigger!

[Admiring Sheila]
Well aren't you the sweetest little thing?

[Being handled by Evil Ash]
Don't touch me! You foul thing!
You're gonna learn to love me, missy.
The Promised one will come for you.
Darlin' I'm gonna save him the trouble.
Keep your damn filthy bones outta my mouth.
Let's get the hell out of here!
Into the pit with those bloody-thirsty sons of whores!
You're going down!
I'm going up!
Now I swear the next one of you primates even *touches* me...
That's it, go ahead and run. Run home and cry to mama!

[stabbing at Ash's car]
What a piece of armor this is!
[to his skeleton minions, who are digging up corpses in a graveyard]
Dig, damn you! Dig faster! I shall command every worm-infested son-of-a-bitch that ever died in battle!
Thank you, sir!
Ash emerges from a cave where he's been asleep for 700 years. He looks overjoyed]
Ha ha. Manufactured parts. Ha...
[Look of joy turns to horror as he sees a world devastated by nuclear war]
No. No. Oh God I slept too long!

[as the credits start]
Hahahahahahahahaha...

[to Arthur]
You know your shoe lace is untied.
London bridge is falling down, falling down, falling doown!
[steps on a nail held by the mini Ashes]
My fair lady ha!
Oh you little bastards! All right, I'll crush each and every last one of ya! I'll squash you so hard you'll have to look down to look up!
Hey dumbass!

[dragging topless wench]
We got plans for you, Girlie-girl!
I'll cut off your gizzard.

[pulling a newly animated skeleton from the grave]
Welcome back to the land of the livin'... NOW PICK UP A SHOVEL AND GET DIGGING!
Say hello to the twenty-first century!
Cry Havoc and let loose the Dogs of War!

[to himself]
Like, like what am I supposed to do - take one book, or all books, or what?

[after being sucked into a blackhole in a fake copy of the Necronomicon and struggling back out]
Whoa. Wrong book.
So what's the deal? Can you send me back or not?
Only the Necronomicon has the power. An unholy book which we also require. Within its pages are passages that can send you back to your time. Only you the promised one can quest for it.
I don't want your book, I don't want your bullshit. Just send me back to my own time, pronto, today. Chop chop!
You can count on my steel.
I know you're scared; we're all scared, but that doesn't mean were cowards. We can take these skeletons, we can take them, with science.
We can take these Deadites, we can take 'em! With science.

[after crushing skeletons with boulders]
Ooh that's gotta hurt.
I'll spoil those good looks back stabber.

[Upon seeing demonic Sheila]
There's a sight for sore bones.

[during the battle, and the undead start ramming the castle gate]
Jeez, put your backbones into it!
[after reaching the location of the Necronomicon, and finding three identical books]
[scratches himself in the head]
Three books? Wait a minute... Hold it... Nobody said anything about three books!
Oh, you miserable bags of bones! Pick yourselves up and sally fo-, sally for-, sally forth.
